page.title: 05COAL MINING
page.content: There have been over 20 coalmines in the immediate area of Shotts. All these 'pits' are now closed. The coal seams worked vary in thickness from 16 to 48 inches:40 to 120 cm. Due to the thin seams and difficult geology the mines were never highly mechanised. Pit ponies were used.The only coal being extracted now is in opencast sites operated by contractors. Some of the moorland has been superficially changed by this work ,as the overburden has been replaced and seeded,or in some part planted with conifers.Some drainage has also been done. Many street names commemorate old mines e.g:BATON,BELMONT,FORTISSAT, HILLHOUSERIGG,RIMMON,NORTHFIELD, STARRYSHAW,HIRST.
